msItem.title: I. ʾArägawi mänfäsawi “Spiritual Elder”
msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; the incipit page of the text (first 5 lines: red lines alternate with black ones; line 20th and 22th); elements of the punctuation signs; the titles and Ethiopic numerals of the discourses (homilies), letters and prayers; two initial lines of the colophon.

Fol. 2ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. Let us begin writing a book on the Spiritual Elder, the righteous, called “spiritual” because of divine gifts and a grace of contemplation which God sends (her) for consolation of hermits; and for their joy and about spiritual visions and secret knowledge...

foreign.p: Fols. 161va-162ra: I pray and entreat from the one who wrote this petition (?) this book for the sake of Christ’s love. For His is honour and glory and majesty and power. As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end, Amen.

div.span: The Syriac mss. contain Rêšê dîḏaʽṯâ i.e., “Chapters of Knowledge” (Beulay 1978: 262) which were rendered into Gəˁəz as ˀArˀəstä ˀaˀəmro (“Chapters of Knowledge” or “Heads of Knowledge”). In front of the title, the Ethiopian translator added dərsan bä-ˀəntä and retained the plural form of ˀArˀəst. For that reason in some catalogues of Ethiopic mss. a translation “Homilies on the heads of knowledge” may be encountered (s. e.g., Orient 529, EMML no. 1937, EMML no. 2838, EMML no. 4043).

p.span: The Arabic versions contain 32 discourses, 48 letters and 3 Chapters of Knowledge (Beulay 1978:276).

Fol. 162rab: This book was translated from the Arabic language into the new language, Gǝʿǝz, on the word of the order of Lǝbnä Dǝngǝl, the King.
And as to this book, I let it be written for the sake of Jesus Christ’s love...

The colophon refers to the translation of the work in the time of King Lǝbnä Dǝngǝl (r. 1496/97-1540). Lacuna on fol. 162ra was probably meant for the name of the direct commissioner of the translation. For other colophons of the Mss. of ʾArägawi mänfäsawi see:DD-036, MAKM-012and MAKM-091.

div.span: Fol. 162rab: This book was completed in the year of St. John the Evangelist and in the reign of our King ˀIyasu, in the year of the world 7000, in the year of mercy 176, the 12th epact, the 18th mäṭqəˁ, in the 19th night, from the 5th day in the month of Ḫədar…

colophon.note: Date meant is probably 7176 "year of the world" (separated into two dates according to two eras, cp. QSM-007), i.e., in 1684 A.D. (cp. Ms. MAKM-091, 1664 A.D.), during the reign of King ʾIyasu I (r. 1682-1706).
